programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 1
programme.desc: In this episode, Ken Marschall gives us a compelling look back at Titanic’s last night through the eyes of survivor Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: Ismay Urged More Speed
programme.desc: How involved was Bruce Ismay with the operation of White Star ships at sea? Did he really urge Captain Smith to ignore ice warnings? Senan’s uncovered an account from the Oceanic that suggests Ismay overrode the command of at least one Captain in a...

programme.title: The Mirage Theory
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson gives us a clear and thorough explanation of the Mirage Theory. Does this theory really explain why Titanic hit the iceberg?

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest...

programme.title: How Did Titanic Sink?
programme.desc: He’s visited the wreck more than 30 times in the last 25 years. P.H. Nargeolet gives us his personal observations about the wreck and how Titanic might have gone down.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Did Titanic Have Inferior Steel?
programme.desc: It’s been a theory talked about for years; were the rivets and steel used in Titanic inferior? Parks looks at the science of the debate and very well may put an end to the controversy.

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why...

programme.title: The Anchor Crane Mystery - Ken Marschall
programme.desc: When the first images of Titanic came back in 1985, everyone noticed how the bow anchor crane was turned to a very unusual position; even considering the crash into the ocean floor. Jim Cameron’s got one theory about what happened and Ken Marschall’s...

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Titanic's Press Photography
programme.desc: White Star was known for its strong marketing efforts and innovative sales tactics. Titanic interior expert Daniel Klistorner, explains why the photographs taken by the press were so important then and still are today.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: The J.J. Davies Bag
programme.desc: As bodies were recovered on the Mackay-Bennett, they were given a number and the personal items found on the body were put into a mortuary bag. This is the real life story of one of those bags from Body No. 200!

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Inquiries and More
programme.desc: In part two of his series on lost documents, Charles Haas looks at other significant collections of Titanic documents that have simply disappeared in one way or another over the years.

programme.title: Money Troubles
programme.desc: People traveling in 1912 needed to take a lot of cash along on their journey. Unlike today, Europe and America were both cash societies and often that became a problem.

programme.title: The Hazards of First-Class Travel
programme.desc: Traveling first-class on Titanic was certainly luxurious. Most of the passengers were very pleasant and the food was good, but you had to be careful about letting your guard down. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder reveals the very real dangers of...

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Elevator Grills
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Inside Sailing 2025 - Episode 6
programme.desc: In our previous episode, we travelled to Hyères – France for the Olympic Sailing Week. In this new episode, we bring attention to some of the participants that helped the Semaine Olympique Française showcase its reputation once again, hearing their stories. We then travel to Greece, for the 39th International Regatta Brindisi-Corfu. We are then following some exciting foiling action with the Formula Kite European Championships that hit the waters of Urla, Türkiye, for this year’s event. Finally, this venue also played host to another European Championship : the 2025 Doğuş Marine Services Formula Wing European Championships.

programme.title: Inside Sailing 2025 - Episode 4
programme.desc: In our previous episode, we travelled to Oman for a non-competitive, yet exciting adventure, the Oman Downwinder. We also featured Match Racing action. As always, our eyes were also in the future of sport. For the 10th year in a row, the Saronicos Bay was “home” for the “Nikos Sarikavazis Trophy”. We start this episode with Mallorca for the Trofeo Princesa Sofía Mallorca by FERGUS Hotels. We will once again bring foiling to the spotlight of Inside Sailing. Foiling Week is the first and only global event of its kind dedicated to a range of foiling boats and boards, bringing together athletes, designers, and manufacturers from across the globe.Let’s now focus further on one of the foiling disciplines : the wing foiling and the Wing Foil Racing World Cup. A new season has just started for this sport and Inside Sailing will bring all the action during the next months.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cléac'h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2023 New Zealand
programme.desc: Opening up the 2023 GWA season, the Tip Top GWA Wingfoil World Cup, presented by Armstrong Foils, is the first the GWA event in New Zealand or the Pacific. Featuring both the Surf-Slalom and Surf-Freestyle disciplines, this first world cup event of the season will be held at Mount Maunganui Main Beach over 6 days of an 8 day window, 3rd-11th March. Over this event period in early March there are to expect wind strengths of 10-18 knots each day in the afternoons with the sea breezes further building up to 15-25 knots.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #1
programme.desc: Comme si gravir 2.250 m de dénivelé dans les montagnes du Beaufortain en ski alpinisme ne suffisait pas, les coureurs engagés sur cette 39e Pierra Menta, ont dû performer malgré des conditions météo capricieuses. Pluie, neige et brouillard se sont invités sur la 1ère des 4 étapes mais n’ont pas freiné l’enthousiasme des 430 engagés au départ d’Arêches Beaufort au niveau du plateau des Pauses.

programme.title: Lekkarod 2025
programme.desc: Depuis 10 ans, la Lekkarod est une course majeure du mushing en Europe. Affiliée aux fédérations nationale FFST et internationale IFSS, elle est une étape de la Coupe du Monde. Chaque année, une centaine de mushers et leurs chiens prennent le départ des 9 étapes de la Lekkarod, ou de celles des Trophées !For the past 10 years, the Lekkarod has been a major mushing race in Europe. Affiliated with the national FFST and international IFSS federations, it is a stage of the World Cup. Each year, around a hundred mushers and their dogs take part in the 9 stages of the Lekkarod, or those of the Trophies!

programme.title: 5 Torri Winter Hike
programme.desc: We snow shoe in the heart of the Dolomites, above Cortina, to the enchanted 5 Torri and stop at the Rifuggio Scoiattolo for refreshments. Nous partons en raquettes au cœur des Dolomites, au-dessus de Cortina, jusquaux magnifiques "5 Torri" et nous nous arrêtons au Rifuggio Scoiattolo pour nous rafraîchir.

programme.title: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip
programme.desc: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip

programme.title: Running the Loowit Trail on Mt St Helens
programme.desc: The Loowit Trail circumnavigates Mount St. Helens, past old-growth forests, waterfalls, meadows, and the leftovers of the volcanos 1980 eruption. We ran the roughly 30 mile trail, starting from Climbers Bivouac Campground. (English version with French and Italian subtitles)

programme.title: The Best Hike In Switzerland - Zermatt to Mettelhorn (Eng)
programme.desc: Mettelhorn and Platthorn are hidden gems as a one-day out-and-back hiking/mountaineering trip from Zermatt. Its a good route to help acclimatise to bigger mountains in the area. The route starts from the northern outskirts of Zermatt, Switzerlands picturesque ski resort town, taking paths that zig-zag up the mountain and take you to some stunning Alpine views of famous mountains like the Matterhorn, Zinalrothorn, and Weisshorn. The journey to Mettelhorn was a unique Alpine experience that doesnt pack the same effort punch that lies in most Mountaineering routes while still delivering spectacular mountain views

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 1 - Caroline Gleich
programme.desc: Caroline Gleich, a world class ski mountaineer, summited Mt. Everest last spring as part of her #ClimbForEquality campaign to raise awareness for gender equality. In Episode 1, Gleich overcomes her own struggle after tearing her ACL to rise to the top for all women. (English version with French, Italian, German and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: Climbing Skye s Highest Peak - Sgurr Alasdair
programme.desc: Cris and Viv decided to climb Sgurr Alasdair, the highest mountain on the island of Skye, located in an area of the mountain range known as Black Cullin. The main challenge they had in climbing the peak was the Great Stone Chute. A 300-meter slope of the harshest mountain terrain - scree. The summit of Sgurr Alasdair has unobstructed views of all of the Munroes in the Black Cullin, and also of one of Skyes most famous routes - The Cullin Ridge traverse.

programme.title: Open Faces Obertauern 2024
programme.desc: The 4*Freeride World Tour Challenger provides the big stage for the final decisions for qualification for the Freeride World Tour 2025. This international freeride contest is taking place in Obertauern for the first time and offers ideal conditions for this event with numerous freeride options.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 4
programme.desc: Axelle Gachet-Mollaret et Lorna Bonnel remportent cette 39e édition de la Pierra Menta avec classe. Chez les hommes, Xavier Gachet etWilliam Bon Mardion simposent et réalisent un doublé historique 10 jours après leur titre de champion du monde par équipe

programme.title: The First Second - Sam Anthamatten
programme.desc: A specialist in high mountains, Sam is a committed freerider, but behind his instinct to ski, there is a guide: it is his job, his culture. At each line, an internal struggle begins between security and risk-taking ... The balance is difficult, with great freedom involved. Through his practice, he lives and perpetuates a mythical image, that of the Zermatt guide.

programme.title: Skiing China, Exploring Altai Mountains
programme.desc: A quartet of champion skiers and snowboarders from Australia and the USA visit the unexplored Altai Frontier in China, now believed to be the place where skiing first developed, more than 10,000 years ago. They encounter the ancient culture of the region and explore the spectacular local slopes, using their own hi-tech equipment as well as the traditional skis manufactured by local craftsmen using age-old practices. The four visitors, Scott Kneller, Jari Hiatt, Halina Boyd and Harry Kearney, all of whom have world-beating careers in snowboarding, skiing and ski mountaineering, discover new challenges and new frontiers in China’s remote north-western province.

programme.title: Lekkarod 2022 (V. Int)
programme.desc: It is an exceptional line-up of mushers that has an appointment for this seventh edition of the Lekkarod. Coming from France, Germany, Switzerland, Spain and Alaska, 30 teams and 13 participants in the ski-joëring category took part in a total of 9 stages. From Chamrousse(Isère) to Bessans (Savoie) via Val DArly, the Lekkarod is an event counting for the IFSS World Cup (International Federation of Sleddog Sports).

programme.title: Three Peaks (Eng)
programme.desc: Amazing winter snow shoe hike to the famous Three Peaks (Tre Cime/ Drei Zinnen) in the Dolomites with avalanche beepers and expert alpine guides.

programme.title: Engadin Ski Marathon 2023
programme.desc: On Sunday, March 12, 2023, more than 14,000 athletes competed in the 53rd edition of the Engadin Skimarathon, the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners. What awaits them on this day in the high valley are 42 strenuous kilometers over frozen lakes, past typical Engadine villages and through a picturesque Swiss Alpine landscape. The best completed the course in a time of around 1.5 hours.

programme.title: Backcountry skiing at Mcgillivray Lodge Eng
programme.desc: In March of 2021, Jeff and a group of friends took a helicopter from Pemberton, which is about 2 hours north of Vancouver, to an area called Whitecap Alpine to stay in the backcountry at McGillivray Pass Lodge for 4 nights and experience 4 great days of backcountry skiing.

programme.title: Donzi XLV – Palm Beach International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett steps aboard the Donzi XLV, an elegant day boat for unforgettable moments. Discover its performance.

programme.title: Riviera 465 SUV A unique vessel in the marketplace
programme.desc: Hop on the Riviera 465 SUV, a luxury motorboat built in Australia by world-famous builder Riviera. It’s a sport utility vessel and a unique vessel in the marketplace.

programme.title: Cobia 218 DC Miami Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is aboard the Cobia 218 Dual Console. Thanks to its versatility, this family-friendly boat is perfect for both fishing and relaxing.

programme.title: Scanner Envy 1200 – Fulfilled dreams
programme.desc: The shipyard Scanner Marine has fulfilled the dream of those asking for a model such as this Scanner Envy 1200, and our Bacci Del Buono is in Varazze to test it out! Born from the creativity and craftsmanship of Donato Montemitro, this model is everything you were waiting for.

programme.title: FTP Industrial
programme.desc: FTP Industrial is a society that has been constructing marine engines for over 150 years. Guglielmo Tummarello, Head of Product Portfolio, Marketing and Sales Marine of FPT INDUSTRIAL talks about it.

programme.title: Genova Boat Show 2022 - Motor
programme.desc: Maurizio Bulleri takes you on board the new motor boats present at the Genova International Boat Show 2022. Discover the novelties by Absolute, Azimut, Ferretti Yachts, Sunseeker and many others.

programme.title: Greenovation
programme.desc: The Boat Show introduces you to an innovative patented technology that absorbs hydrocarbons and their derivatives dispersed in water. Its called FoamFlex200 and it was developed by the company Test1.

programme.title: Miami International Boat Show 2024 - Accessories
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese takes you to discover the most innovative nautical accessories of the Miami International Boat Show 2024. The show is full of innovations and cutting-edge solutions proposed by companies from all over the world.

programme.title: Simrad - Glass Bridge systems
programme.desc: Hop on board the maxi rib Ranieri International Cayman 45.0 Cruiser and test the Glass Bridge systems by Simrad, with two monitors that display a lot of information.

programme.title: Venice Boat Show 2022 - Best of (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show has selected the best moments of the Venice Boat Show. An edition to discover and enjoy.

programme.title: Sea Doo Switch - MIBS 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese and Bill Hackett present a walkthrough of the Sea-Doo pontoon boat at the 2024 Miami International Boat Show, capable of over 100 mph on just two outboard motors.

programme.title: 43 Wallytender - A multifunctional platform
programme.desc: An exclusive test in company of Luca Bassani, founder of Wally Yachts e Stefano De Vivo, managing director. The new 43 Wallytender offers the possibility to easily change the layout.

programme.title: Boat2go
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese introduces you to Boat2go, a boat rental company located in the Lecco-Bellagio area of Northern Italy. It has everything you’ll need for the ideal boating trip or boating adventure!

programme.title: Xenta - X-Aid
programme.desc: Review of the new Xenta X-Aid, an innovative and fully integrated boat control system, mounted on board Ferretti 670. Discover it Maurizio Bulleri.

programme.title: Cataldo Aprea Interview with
programme.desc: Cataldo Aprea, founder and CEO of Apreamare, talks about himself and Apreamare in an exclusive interview.

programme.title: How to - Anchor with Raymarine
programme.desc: Welcome to another appointment with "How to". In this episode Bacci Del Buono explains how to correctly set the alarm for anchoring.

programme.title: Multiple engines
programme.desc: Weve recently seen up to six outboards on a single boat, but what is the right number of engines on a boat? Our Maurizio Bulleri is about to tell you!Discover all you need to know amount multiple engines…

programme.title: Scout Boats – Miami International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett sits down with Alan Lang, Director of Sales and Marketing for Scout Boats, to talk about the legacy of the Scout Boats range and the debut of the Scout Boats 670 in September.

programme.title: MJM 4 - A strong heritage
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show on board a motor boat with a strong heritage, the MJM4. Peter Johnstone, from MJM Yachts, talks about this incredible boat.

programme.title: Seakeeper 2 - on board Beneteau Flyer 9
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono is on board the Beneteau Flyer 9 to explain the functioning of the Seakeeper 2, a system that aims to reduce the onboard rolling up to 95.

programme.title: Ocean Alexander - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the MIBS 2023 to interview Dan Mundy, Global Head of Sales Ocean Alexander.

programme.title: Edoardo Recchi – The interview
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese interviews for you Edoardo Recchi, Sports Director of the Yacht Club Costa Emerald.

programme.title: Suncoast Boat Show Eng
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Suncoast Boat Show, a must-see event for boating enthusiasts and industry professionals, and Bill Hackett provides a detailed overview of the boats on display.

programme.title: Rendez-V Marine - 2023 (Eng)
programme.desc: Discover the sixteenth edition of the Rendez-V Marine, an event organized by V Marine and dedicated to the owners and enthusiasts of Azimut Yachts and Pirelli Speedboats.

programme.title: A Day Of Fire with Truck 4
programme.desc: 48 Hours with Truck 4s "C" Shift. They arrive on-scene to find a small trailer blazing and a possibly a dangerous situation with an LP gas tank near the trailer. The next day they are called in to a large apartment fire and our directed to perform one of the many things that the Fresno Fire Department does right, Salvage". They is where Firemen do their best to protect and preseve the belongs at the homes where there is a fire incident. Their respect for peoples homes and their personal property is something we have never seen with any other department. The truck crew starts salvage. In late afternoon, a call comes in as smoke showing from a building. The Truck Company arrives on scene of a Dollar Store and are directed to the rear. In the storage area, it is filled with smoke. The Crew bring out their thermal imagers and scan for hotspots.

programme.title: I Witness Medical Interns Episode 1
programme.desc: Still, young idealistic kids, with images of "GREY’S ANATOMY" floating in their heads are becoming doctors. The question is Why? The video journalists of "I Witness" live, eat and breathe alongside a group of residents at a large New Orleans hospital.

programme.title: #10 with Eng 9
programme.desc: Station 9, Engine 9 and the "B" Shift with Captain Karey Wedemeyer and her crew. !st call of the morning is an EMS call, a young woman is pregnant and out of breath, she has Asthma. The Paramedics arrive and assist the crew as they administer medication, pack her up for transport to the ambulance. The crew shop for their entire 48 hour shift. Back at the station, they stow their food and a call comes in about smoke in a local restaurant in the Tower District They arrive on scene to find a street fair celebration. They check with the thermal imager to see if they can locate where the smoke is coming from. They get back to the station, finally have lunch and a call comes in. Turns out that an arsonist might have started a small field on fire and now its into the eves of this single family dwelling.

programme.title: Part 2 of 24 with Engine 3
programme.desc: Firefighter/engineer Chris Garcias family drops by for Easter Sunday. The guys are in the kitchen cooking up lunch, and a call comes and they are onto the rig. The Fire Company arrives at the scene to a shooting. The police had been in a pursuit of gang bangers in a black SUV. They find them and a shoot out occurs and the police shoot a suspect to a killing. Next up, a vehicle accident. Night falls and a call comes in for a commercial structure fire. Eng. 3s "A" Shift is 1st in on a Antique Store fire owned by a horder.

programme.desc: Travelling to some of the most idyllic places to try the local cuisine that each destination has to offer, and some travel tips along the way. Featuring the delights of Sorrento in Italy to the delacasies of South Africa.

programme.title: Roberta & Christina
programme.desc: These property hunters are looking for their next dream getaway! Paradise is in your backyard when you're at one of these luxurious vacation homes.

programme.title: Elbe Princesse
programme.desc: We’re off to Germany, for a small scale river cruise up the historic Elbe river. We’ll visit castles built for royalty and marvel at the tomb of a saint, all aboard a custom built river cruiser.

programme.title: Morning Movers
programme.desc: Don’t miss the go-to resource for pre-market action from the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Join Diane King Hall for breaking economic news, expert analysis, technical insights, and real-time trading strategies.

programme.title: Opening Bell
programme.desc: Opening Bell

programme.title: Morning Trade Live
programme.desc: Sam Vadas takes traders beyond the headlines with a sharp focus on the macro drivers, sector rotations, and global forces shaping the day’s market action. From breaking down U.S. and international economic data to analyzing sector performance and cross-asset moves, Morning Trade Live delivers the context traders need to understand the “why” behind early trading activity.

programme.title: Trading 360
programme.desc: After the dust settles from the opening bell, Trading 360 with Marley Kayden features Wall Street’s best traders, analysts and technicians to break down sectors and stocks moving markets. Trading 360 focuses on disruptive companies and new technologies driving market headlines while providing investors a 360-degree actionable approach to trading.

programme.title: Fast Market
programme.desc: Host Diane King Hall teams up with veteran traders Tom White and Kevin Hincks to break down live market moves and deliver actionable trade ideas in real time. From options strategies and volatility plays to earnings reactions, they bring in market specialists, analysts, and guests to give active traders the setups and strategies they can use right now.

programme.title: The Carl Jackson Podcast
programme.desc: Bill Maxwell

programme.title: CJC Family Music
programme.desc: Music

programme.title: Immortal Soul
programme.desc: "Immortal Soul" is a 2022 drama film directed by Carl Jackson, about a couple whose love is tested by time and distance until they confront destiny. The film, based on Elijah Jackson's album of the same name, explores themes of the afterlife and premiered on March 25, 2022.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Six Monsters of poker with more than $60 million in combined career tournament earnings compete at Borgata Hotel & Casino in the WPT Monster Invitational, and Vanessa Selbst commands the chip lead with three players remaining. Selbst, David Williams, and Phil Laak battle at the winner-take-all final table for a special World Poker Tour prize package and a pair of Monster 24K® headphones.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: The World Poker Tour returns to Playground Poker Club in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and 732 players compete for their share of the more than $2 million prize pool. Season XIII WPT Player of the Year Mukul Pahuja is at the final table, looking to finally etch his name on the coveted WPT Champions Cup™, and he is joined by fellow professionals Jonathan Jaffe, Kevin MacPhee, and local Sam Chartier.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Five players remain at the final table of WPT Montreal at Playground Poker Club. The winner will take home more than $400,000, along with a pair of Monster® 24K® headphones and a Hublot® King Power Unico Watch. Season XIII WPT Player of the Year Mukul Pahuja sits in third chip position, trailing chip leader Jonathan Jaffe and Ratharam Sivagnanam.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Only Jonathan Jaffe and Ratharam Sivagnanam stand between Season XIII WPT Player of the Year Mukul Pahuja and his first World Poker Tour title. The winner of WPT Montreal at Playground Poker Club earns more than $400,000, a pair of Monster® 24K® headphones, a Hublot® King Power Unico Watch, and a seat into the season-ending WPT World Championship.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: The World Poker Tour returns to the legendary Bellagio in Las Vegas, Nevada, where 586 entries compete for their share of the more than $5.6 million prize pool. Season XII WPT champion Mohsin Charania is at the final table, looking to etch his name once again on the coveted WPT Champions Cup™, and he is joined by BLUFF.com WPT Ones to Watch Garrett Greer and professionals Brett Shaffer, Ryan Julius, Ryan Fee, and Tobias Reinkemeier.

programme.title: "UFA 327 - Bash Boxing, MarvNation at Pechanga"
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bash Boxing and MarvnNation Promotions at the Pechanga Resort Casino. In a southpaw against Southpaw match, Fernando Vargas Jr. (9-0) faces Heber Rondon (20-4). In the main event undefeated Jonathan Lopez (10-0) with 7 KOs takes on more the experienced Eduardo Baez (21-4).

programme.title: UFA 317 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) - Millender vs. Ahmadyar
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting, UNF - Millender versus Ahmad from Burbank, CA. In this episode of UFA Christopher Padilla faces El J Portee in a Catchweight bout and Jesse Strader with an 80 knockout rate takes on Taylor Alfaro. The main event is a battle between Northern and Southern California and the title for the UNF Middleweight Championship is on the line when Bellator and UFC veteran Curtis Millender takes on top ranked Salaiman Ahmadyar.

programme.title: UFA 344 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 8 - Wassmer vs. Lua
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 8 from Southern California. In this episode, Kester Abad faces Dylan Stockard in a flyweight bout and Daniel Labastida and Matheus Santos face off in a bantamweight contest. Also watch as David Babakhanyan takes on Daniel Gualajara and in the main event, Elwig Wassmer, defending title holder and a biochemist looks to take on Israel Lua (Ben Jones camp) with knockout power, in whats expected to be a combustible fight with two titles on the line. The fighters contend for both the UNF flyweight title and the California state championship title.

programme.title: UFA 342-343 - Bare Knuckle Boxing 32
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 32 part 1 from London. In the flyweight devision, Salim Jamshidi and Joe Fitzpatrick, both making their pro BKB debut, battle for the win. Stanlee Wilson faces Tony Barratt, Reece Murray takes on the much more experienced Jonny Lawson, Danny Meins goes head to head with Tony Meeham and Martyn Grainger faces Eryk Majda in the Cruiserweight division. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 32 part 2 from London. Steven Evans takes on Matty Moore in a Wales versus Ireland fight in the middleweight division. Beau Besley faces Michael Devine in a featherweight clash, Lawrence Tracey and Kevin Greenwood match up in a light-heavyweight bout, Scott McHugh takes on Aaron McCallum in a British Bantamweight title fight. In the main event Jimmy Sweeney takes on Kearon Thomas in the lightweight division.

programme.title: A Surfer's Guide to Ventura County Coast
programme.desc: We asked a group of local surfers where they choose to ride the waves, shop for gear and unwind in Ventura County, California.

programme.title: Adventurous East London Locations
programme.desc: Mira Ovaskainen of VALO shares the Top Spots to visit in the Coolest East London Neighborhoods. Watch now & get adventurous on your London trip!

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: Kauai's Top 10 Must-See's
programme.desc: Few islands are more visually stunning than Kauai — from the ground, in the air, or on the water.

programme.title: Check Out This Resort On The High Seas!

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Michaela Guzy's Top Unexpected NYC Experiences
programme.desc: Michaela Guzy, New Yorker and founder of the website Oh The People You Meet, shares her favorite hidden gems in the city.

programme.title: Kanda Myojin
programme.desc: Located in Chiyoda, this Shinto shrine has been watching over the neighborhoods of Kanda, Nihonbashi, Akihabara, Ootemachi, Marunouchi and others since the 14th century. Although the Gate of God suffered the fires, earthquakes and wars over the years, the rebuilt pavilion — decked out in stunning vermillion and gold with lacquered interiors — still attracts worshipers and visitors alike. Like the Kanda area itself, the shrine celebrates its history but also looks to the future. On any given day, you’ll find a mix of businessmen praying to the gods for luck and prosperity, young brides wishing for a good marriage, and others simply trying to ward of bad vibes. But the shrine’s priests started reaching out to younger generations with anime characters and charms that look like SD cards. Every other May, the shrine becomes a centerpiece for Kanda Matsuri, one of Tokyo’s most famous festivals since the Edo period. Locals parade with their favorite deities, or kami, through the neighborhoods, making their way to the shrine for the ultimate bash. If you think you have a samurai spirit, this should feel like home.

programme.title: The Crazy & Fun Side of London

programme.title: Issaya
programme.desc: The dining room is a daring mix of classic and modern furniture on terracotta tile floors with unusually colourful wallpapers. The whole room basks in a very soft light and the result works surprising well. The menu, both in Thai and English, is not illustrated but cleverly written, keeping the phonetic dish names instead of an elaborated but hard to visualize description. The wine list is substantial and several excellent wines are available by the glass.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Top 5 Things to do in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: Teri travels to the British Virgin Islands to explore the top things to do including sailing, diving, island hopping, indulging in spa treatments, and visiting the world famous Baths. Teri later visits the Bomba Shack on Tortola and talks with its legendary owner, Bomba.

programme.title: Broken Spanish
programme.desc: Theres a distinct image that might pop up in your head when you think of Mexican food. It may involve a puddle of beans next to over-sauced enchiladas. It may involve yellow cheese and crunchy shells. It may involve trucks and outdoor salsa bars. It most likely does not involve crispy skinned pork belly studded with pungent elephant garlic and elegantly strewn with radish sprouts and micro herbs. But maybe it should.Chef Ray Garcia—a born-and-bred Angeleno—is on the forefront of the modern Mexican food movement thats taking over the city, and Broken Spanish is his swanky flagship. The aforementioned CHICHARRON is one of the best large-format meat dishes in a 50-mile radius, while the LAMB NECK TAMAL is all gamey funk and pillowy tender masa. For dessert, the CAFE DE OLLA is a Mexican firing squad of chocolate, beer, and coffee to the face. The hyper-modern space—a mix of retro concrete breezeblocks, macrame, and greenery—is the perfect spot for that mezcal nightcap.

programme.title: Why visitors are hooked on Dubai Marina, home to luxury yachts, docks, hotels and beach clubs
programme.desc: Whether you see it from the deck of a boat or the wire of its 1km zipline, Dubai Marina is a spectacle of ground-breaking architecture, bespoke superyachts and luxury shoreline hospitality. This sought-after holiday destination encompasses the coastal neighbourhood of Jumeirah Beach Residence, known locally as JBR, home to retail and entertainment developments The Walk and The Beach, which multiple the attractions for fun-seekers. Iconic five-star hotels hug the shoreline, their vast marble lobbies leading to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunches and postcard-perfect beaches. Le Méridien Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina is one of the longest-standing hotels in Dubai Marina with 500 metres of private Arabian Gulf coastline providing a playground for water sports enthusiasts. Local expats regularly fill the resort’s Barasti bar, restaurant and beach club. A Dubai institution in its second decade, this well-liked venue has grown into a sprawling sports and beach bar with open-air screenings and food stalls, and the only free-entry beach club in town. Despite progression, Barasti retains its original theme, defined by palm fronds typically found in the traditional barasti shelters favoured by the early Bedouins. Other Dubai Marina beach clubs that draw crowds include Drift to Zero Gravity . Drift is dizzyingly beautiful; its pool deck, a catwalk for the latest swimwear fashions. Open until late, Zero Gravity is known for its high-octane parties and voyeuristic glass-sided pool. Sun worshippers on Dubai Marina’s deep sandy beaches pose for photos that frame its remarkable urban skyline. It’s a backdrop that’s hard to miss, containing some of the tallest residential towers in the world. The 101-storey Princess Tower once claimed the title of the highest, while the Cayan Tower retains its record for the world’s tallest building with a 90-degree twist; it’s structure akin to a giant corkscrew. Flying through the skyscrapers on XLine Dubai is an exhilarating way to experience this brave a

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: Dubai: Discover the jewels in the crown of the city's civilisation
programme.desc: When people think of Dubai it is often thought of as a new city. But, in fact, its history goes back more than 5,000 years. Archaeologists have unearthed a series of exciting and mysterious discoveries across the Emirate. These include the Jumeirah Archaeological site, which dates back to the Abbasid Period in the 10th century AD, to the Saruq Al Hadid site – a centre for human inhabitants and trade and metallurgy from the Umm Al Nar period (2600-2000 BCE) to the Iron Age. When the Jumeirah Archaeological site was discovered, experts noticed that the walls of the buildings there were plastered. Dr Mansour Boraik, an archaeology specialist from Dubai, said: "It was plastered inside and outside with white plaster. When they tried to picture the city during the Abbasid Period, and they imagined that it would look like a white city from the shores of the Gulf." The site shows Dubai during the Abbasid period which is around the 10th century AD. The geographical location of the site is important. It sits on the shoreline of Dubai but also on the major trade route between Mesopotamia, India and Oman. It also sits in-between the Arabic and Indian peninsular. The 80,000 square metre site sits in the shadow of the Burj Khalifa and the imposing Dubai skyline, emphasising the comparison between old and new worlds. The circular and semi-circular tower supports reflect the prosperity of the inhabitants of the time who will have been a mixture of locals and passing tradesmen. A variety of silver coins, pottery, copper, glass and stone artefacts have been excavated. Its one of the largest and most important Islamic sites ever discovered in the Gulf. It is also home to the oldest Mosque discovered in the UAE. Saruq al Hadid Saruq al Hadid is regarded as the jewel in the crown of archaeological discoveries In Dubai. This ancient industrial metallurgical centre dates back to the Iron Age and indicates that Dubai was a global trading hub. Ahmed Mahmoud, Director of Architectural Heritage Department in Dubai, said

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.desc: From the simple perfection of summer boating, to the daily eruption of energy that is Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong has you covered an all things food, drink, entertainment, and lifestyle. The enchanting neighborhoods are coiled with history and culture, each with its own timeline of stories that speak persuasively about Hong Kong’s modernization. Situated against the backdrop of its secret cove-like harbor, the architecture that graces the land is just as extreme. Hong Kong sits atop the throne as the city with the most skyscrapers in the world, yet the urbanized areas are only a fraction of the city itself. The nature that surrounds and pushes through the city, gives Hong Kong it’s true indescribable magic. Denizens know where to find the hiking trails, the views, and escape routes to the open sea. The endless culinary delights, bold experiences, and hidden treasures make Hong Kong a torchbearer of culture, innovation, and lifestyle in Asia.

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in Puerto Rico
programme.desc: Number 10: Go for a hike in El Yunque National park – This is the only subtropical rainforest in the US (besides Hawaii) and is filled with so much bio diversity. Make sure you spot the ylang ylang tree to smell the beautiful flowers used in some of the best perfumes. http://ecotourspuertorico.com/el-yunque-tours-rainforest/ Number 9: Have lunch in La Placita at Chef Jose Enrique’s restaurant. Jose Enrique is an award winning chef who uses his master culinary skills to enrich traditional Puerto Rican dishes. http://www.joseenriquepr.com/ Number 8: Shop in el Mercado in La Placita – Be sure to stop by and talk to Hector Ruiz Housler, who sells herbs and concoctions used to treat all sorts of ailments. Number 7: Have a cafecito at Café Cuatro Sombras - Located in Old San Juan and has the richest, most authentic Puerto Rican coffee in town. http://cuatrosombras.com/ Number 6: Visit Casa Cortés - Indulge your senses in fine chocolate and fine art here. Try their chocolate and cheese snack and sample one of their delicious chocolate beverages. http://www.casacortespr.com/ Number 5: Go to Piñones for authentic Puerto Rican street food – Try the fresh oysters, clams and all of the delicious fried food offered here. Be sure to pass by the cultural center to learn the history of this important Puerto Rican neighborhood. Number 4: Spend an afternoon in the Botanical Gardens – Take a tour and smell the cinnamon and bay rum trees and if you’re lucky, you just might spot a coqui. http://sanjuanpuertorico.com/san-juan-botanical-garden-jardin-botanico-universidad-de-puerto-rico/ Number 3: Stay on Condado Beach. I love the San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. It’s a quick drive from the airport, has breathtaking views, and has amazing service. http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/sjupr-san-juan-marriott-resort-and-stellaris-casino/ Number 2: Have a Bioluminescence experience - Puerto Rico has three Bioluminescent bays which contain millions of micro-organisms, called “dinoflagellates”, that glow fluorescent in the dark when agi

programme.title: From kayaking to fitness workouts: Dubai enriches its offer for the health conscious traveller
programme.desc: With its untamed environment and rugged landscape, Hatta is the picture-perfect destination. And this centuries’ old exclave of Dubai also caters for today’s health conscious traveller. High up in the Hajar mountains you can soak up the history while doing a spot of hiking. There are 32 kilometres of track in the area. More than a dozen possible routes have been mapped out, with four different levels of ability. Kayaking is also on offer on the vast lake next to the Hatta dam. Fitness expert and Youtube star Lilly Sabri @lillysabri says the walking is an ideal complement to a regular routine. “I think that when you’re on a holiday you want to make memories as well… so trying different things,” she says. “So, if you’re someone goes to the gym wherever you normally train and in whatever country that might be, it might be nice to try something different. So, getting outside. You certainly couldn’t do this in London where I’m originally from. So, it’s keeping fit and healthy but in a different way.” Wellness tourism has evolved to become the travel industry’s fastest growing sector – something Dubai is continuing to expand upon and develop. Across town amongst the shimmering Jumeirah Lakes Towers you will find the SMSF Heartfulness Meditation Centre. It’s the only one of its kind in the MENA region and they hold daily meditation classes that attract up to 500 people. “I think we just forgot where... we’ve been so focused on external gratification... now people are actually zoning in and they realise what’s important on how we feel and how we can impact on those around us,” says fitness expert Christian Williams. “This place in Dubai is not just where people live, it’s a stop off where people go on vacation. So, what we’re doing here in Heartfulness Meditation is just incredible not just for people living here but anyone who is willing to come and travel. And I can just see us moving forwards and I’m just so pleased I came to this centre because it’s free and it’s on every single week.” “Dubai is gr

programme.title: Duncan Lin
programme.desc: The Story of Duncan Lin“From my earliest memory, I have always liked drawing, but have never thought about making it my career,” says Duncan Lin, one of Taiwan’s most popular comics artists from Hualien. With a fanbase of 20 million and growing, Duncan has been approached by various renowned companies, such as Line, Asus, and TVBS for creative collaborations. He uses a caricature of himself as the main protagonist in his comics, which are centered around the hilarious going-ons of his daily life. With the cameras rolling, he wears his character as a mask, not wishing to expose his face. He is about 5’3, with a skinny frame, his dyed blonde hair peeking out from behind his mask. “My father always objected to my interest in drawing, but my mother was rather supportive. Some of my most precious memories are of those childhood drawings. I would show them to my mother, deeply excited, and she would look at them and say, ‘Oh, that’s [a] really nice picture’, and then display it on the fridge using a magnet. And I would feel so proud every time she did this. I would think, ‘Wow, I need to draw more, because I want more things to be displayed on the fridge’, and then slowly…. the fridge got filled up. And the old drawings would be removed, and the whole process would be repeated. And this small matter, and that fridge, they influenced me, and allowed me to feel like perhaps I should continue drawing in the future.”On the other hand, Duncan’s father was a strict figure, quite the opposite of his mother. “My father never smiled at me from the day I was born till the day he passed away. He never genuinely smiled at me and was always kind of distant - he’s a very, very strict kind of father - so we never really talked much, and of course after I graduated from high school, I left home.” Like all typical Asian parents, Duncan’s father hammered the notion: ‘do not pursue art because you’ll starve to death’, and that if he became an artist, ‘you’ll only earn money after you’re dead’.During his university years, Duncan majored i

programme.title: Eating Healthy in LA
programme.desc: Get the lowdown on health foodie finds in LA from food blogger Jackie Gebel, otherwise known as @noleftovers_ on Instagram.

programme.title: Off the beaten track, Orlando
programme.desc: Out of the many adventures one can have in Orlando, I choose the off the beaten path things to do. My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: San Miguel
programme.desc: As cultures clash and trends transcend borders, a lot of major destinations are starting to resemble one another - but not San Miguel de Allende. A small town nestled in central Mexico, San Miguel de Allende is anchored in its authenticity. A place where Mexican tradition guides, but doesn’t restrict, the new.The streets are an explosion of colorful colonial buildings, and its people are just as, if not more, vibrant. Home to countless artists and other creative types, San Miguel de Allende is alive with galleries, boutiques, restaurants and rooftop bars - which are perfect for the city’s “eternal spring” weather.At the end of the day, though, it’s a collective sense of pride and love for Mexican culture and history that makes San Miguel de Allende truly a world of its own; a place where ancient rituals live side by side with modern artisanal producers, like Casa Dragones tequila.It’s always in cities like this, where people know exactly who they are and where they come from, that we end up finding ourselves.

programme.title: The Resurgence of The Black Press
programme.desc: Along with the newspaper industry as a whole, the traditional Black press that served as harbingers of Black progress from before Reconstruction to the post-Civil Rights Era, has for many been missing and presumed dead. However, in the wake of COVID and the demands for change following George Floyd’s murder, the Black press has emerged with renewed relevance and a fresh commitment to partnership and innovation. Second-generation Black press owner Lawrence “Larry” Lee of the Observer Media Group joins Beyond The Hype to provide an inside look at the resurgence of traditional Black newspaper brands and why it matters for Black communities.

programme.title: Tank Sings His Way into Women s Hearts
programme.desc: We are on location at the 9th Annual Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit in Boca Raton, Florida. We sit down with rising star Tank, who performs music from his 6th album. Plus, We highlight two Legacy Award winners Myrlie Evers, wife of slain civil rights activist Medgar Evers, and Julieanna Richardson, who is recording our history one story at a time with her company Historymakers.com. And finally, we take a look back at two previous honorees: Cathy Hughes, founder and Chairperson of Radio One; and Marcelite Harris, the first African American to reach the ranks of Major General in the U.S. Air Force. (Ret.).

programme.title: Travel Like a Pro
programme.desc: One of the most influential women in travel, Denella Ri’Chard, host of “Traveling With Denella” shares her best advice for seeing the world

programme.title: Investing In Legacy Laying The Foundation For Multigenerational Wealth
programme.desc: Legacy can mean different things to different people, but it all comes down to leaving a mark that will stand the test of time. Financial Pro ShirleyAnn Robertson shares the ways you can leverage financial strategies and tools to lay a foundation for those who follow, and why it’s important to act now to provide for the future.

programme.title: An Intimate Conversation With Bozoma Saint John
programme.desc: Black Enterprise President and CEO Earl "Butch" Graves Jr. spends time with Netflix Chief Marketing Officer Bozoma Saint John in the latest episode of "From the Corner Office.

programme.title: Best Of Power Forward
programme.desc: On this edition of Women of Power, we take a look back at our “Best Of Power Forward” Series. We lead off with Joi Gordon. The CEO of “Dress For Success, a non-profit helping women understand the power of style and how to gain access to the wardrobe they need to succeed. Then, we sit down with Star Jones as she explains the importance of diversity in the workforce and why we need more women in the C-Suite. From there, we talk to Paula Cholmondeley about why the ultimate power move is serving on a corporate board. Also President of the GM Foundation, Vivian Pickard tells us exactly what it takes to be a good corporate citizen. And finally, television star S. Epatha Merkerson is doing her part in battling diabetes in the black community.

programme.title: Opening Doors in a Budding Industry
programme.desc: Arana Hankin-Biggers and The Travel Agency, a dispensary with four locations in New York City, are working to change how people view cannabis and to leverage profits from its legalization to benefit the communities most hurt by the war on drugs

programme.title: Bodyguards: Secret Lives from the Watchtower
programme.desc: Bodyguards & Protection Agents are the individuals on the front lines for the rich, famous, and powerful. These individuals deal with violence, stalkers, isolation, and potential loss of life every single day. This film explores a world most people know nothing about. Showcasing Nelson Mandelas Bodyguards, Justin Bieber and his Director of Security, Whitey Bulgers Protector, 50 Cent & Lil Waynes Bodyguard, and Ambassadors under Blackwater.

programme.title: The Last Shot
programme.desc: The Last Shot follows American and Mexican basketball players whose careers have been derailed, as they compete in underground, cash-prize Mexican tournaments in search of one last opportunity to make a living playing the game they love.

programme.title: Imitating Life: The Audacity of Suzanne Heintz
programme.desc: This film follows the unlikely but true story of photographer Suzanne Heintz, and an extraordinary act of defiance that catapults her life, and art, into the social media spotlight. She creates a mannequin family and embarks on a global crusade against societal pressure to conform, resulting in a raw, funny and intimate portrait of life through her lens.

programme.title: Autonomy
programme.desc: Iconic author Malcolm Gladwell explores the rising world of self-driving vehicles and the consequences for humanity giving up the wheel. As an examination of the future of driving, AUTONOMY asks the questions: what is control and who do we become as we relinquish it to machines?

programme.title: Hawaii, A Journey Through The Big Island
programme.desc: Experience Big Island bliss in the stunning 2 hour relaxing nature film. Soar above waterfalls that plunge into the Pacific, kick back with views of beach sunsets and slow motion waves, enjoy island palms in the gentle island breezes, and experience the Waipio valley paradise from above. Dazzling cinematography is accompanied by a relaxing soundtrack. Run time 2 hours.

programme.title: Preview for "Nature's Abstracts"
programme.desc: This is a preview for the 2 hour moving art film "Natures Abstracts". Immerse yourself in the wondrous abstract patterns found in nature through the fine art photography of Elizabeth Carmel. Available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Art Subscription Preview
programme.desc: NatureStream.tv Turns Your TV Into Framed Art! We have a large selection of our most popular fine art prints available for display. Learn more at www.Naturestream.tv.

programme.title: Preview of Summer on Mt. Rainier
programme.desc: This is a preview of "Summer on Mt. Rainier", available to stream at www.NatureStream.tv. Experience the beauty of lush wildflower blooms on Mount Rainier paired with a soothing soundtrack in this 50 minute video. 4k UHD Naturestream.TV videos turn your screens into a spectacular display of ambient art that inspires the spirit and soothes the soul.

programme.title: Slo Mo Snow
programme.desc: Experience the wondrous snow storms that blanketed Californias Sierra Mountains in January of 2023 in NatureStream.tvs newest release: "Slo Mo Snow". Filming was done at very slow motion to create an immersive experience of winters beauty. Aerial footage reveals the vast mountain landscape cloaked in snowy splendor. Run time 90 minutes. Available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv

programme.title: Mountain Meadows Nature Film - New 3 Hour Version!
programme.desc: “Mountain Meadows” features wildflower blooms from California’s Table Mountain ecological preserve, along with meadows & lakes in the High Sierra mountains. Stunning drone footage shows the beauty of summer meadows in bloom from an aerial perspective. A relaxing instrumental soundtrack accompanies these uplifting visuals to bring you a wonderful immersion into natures beauty. Available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv. Runtime 2 hours 53 minutes.

programme.title: Nicole Kidman vs. Tom Cruise
programme.desc: S1:E9 Was Scientology the reason why Tom Cruise divorced Nicole Kidman? Nicole was obsessed with Tom. She tried to do everything she could to be with the superstar at all times. But Tom had another obsession: Scientology. Then, when Tom Cruise suddenly divorced Nicole, the world she thought she was living in shattered into a million pieces. Was it because of Scientology? Was it the multiple miscarriages she had? Was it the wiretap Tom allegedly put on Nicole? This story was so uncovered, that our team had to dig deep to get the details.

programme.title: Drake Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E16 Drake went from hip hop hero to deadbeat dad when Kanye West collaborator Pusha T revealed Drake was hiding a secret son, but why was he hiding his son in the first place? And how did Pusha know about it?Everybody assumed Kanye had leaked the information because he was threatened by Drake’s success, but the truth is way more complicated.After digging into Drake and Kanye’s feud and friendship, our team discovered the real story behind Drake’s secret son and the journey he went on to embrace fatherhood for himself.

programme.title: Anna Faris vs. Chris Pratt
programme.desc: S1:E6 If Chris Pratt didn’t have an affair with Jennifer Lawrence, why did he file for divorce From Anna Faris? Chris Pratt and Anna Faris were the famous, ideal couple the world couldn’t get enough of. But when Chris Pratt skyrocketed into superstardom, Anna felt more and more insecure. Then, rumors of Chris having an affair with co-star Jennifer Lawrence emerged. Even though they both deny having an affair, Chris and Annas sudden divorce, fallout of their personal lives, and the health of their son caused a media frenzy that our team got to the bottom of.

programme.title: Kristen Stewart vs. Robert Pattinson
programme.desc: S1:E2 Every girl wanted to be Bella Swan in the blockbuster movie, Twilight. When Kristen Stewart auditioned and got the role, she fell in love with co-star Robert Pattinson shortly after, and the world became obsessed with the new young couple. But what Kristen didn’t expect was the endless media scrutiny, paparazzi following her entire life, and the endless craze from fans. After getting caught in a shocking scandal and being villainized by the entire world. But the media got her story wrongKristen had to embrace her authenticity to have the courage to be who she truly was regardless of what the world thought. We dug into Kristen and Roberts romance to find the real life story behind the tabloids.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Jonny Kim
programme.desc: S1:E3 From the outside, Jonny Kim looks like one of the most ambitious people you’ll ever hear about. A person who can become a Navy SEAL, a doctor and an astronaut all before the age of 40 must be a confident, talented person. However, Jonny didn’t grow up aspiring to be a highly trained soldier-doctor capable of going to outer space. It was only until he experienced one of the darkest, most traumatic things a child could go through, that he discovered a calling way bigger than himself.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise of Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: S1:E2 Frank Shamrock was one of the toughest fighters to ever compete in the UFC. He holds the world record for the fastest consecutive knockouts, but his biggest fight happened when he was a child, living with his stepfather. His stepfather emotionally abused him so devastatingly, that even when Frank was sent to a Juvenile Detention Center, the other kids couldn’t believe what he went through. While many kids would be crushed under such pain and suffering, Frank Shamrock was determined to prove why warriors always find a way to win.

programme.title: Jennifer Asberson: When Rejection Turns Deadly
programme.desc: On September 27, 1992, 19 year old Jennifer Asbenson accepts a ride from a stranger after missing her bus to work. When the man asks for her number, she gives him a fake one to be safe and forgets about it, unaware that she has just refused the advances of a deranged serial killer. At the end of her shift that morning, she does not make it back home. Jennifer escapes twice, yet no one believes what has happened to her. 5 years later, his arrest would reveal the most shocking information.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay Karma is Served
programme.desc: Blind chef, Christine Ha, shocked the nation when she tried out for the reality show cooking competition, Masterchef. Perhaps even more surprising was Gordon Ramsay’s scandalous reaction. She made him eat his words on national tv and made Masterchef history!

programme.title: Vengeance For A Voiceless Child
programme.desc: 8 year old Jennifer wakes up in the middle of the night in the arms of a police officer. The man wants her to believe that she is safe, but she realizes he doesnt have a badge as he drives off to a remote area. Later that night, her kidnapper leaves her for dead in the middle of a field after brutally attacking her, and from that moment on, Jennifer vows to remember every single detail about him in order to make sure he’s caught. Her injuries leave her unable to talk, yet she still finds a way to catch him… 19 years later.

programme.title: Pardeep Kaleka Empathy - The Path From Darkness to Light
programme.desc: This is the remarkable story of Pardeep Kaleka, a faithful Sikh believer, and his quest to track down his fathers killer. In his search for truth, he bonded with a former White Supremacist. What did they have in common? And how did their friendship transform lives around the world? Forgiveness is a powerful tool to heal ourselves, connect deeply, and truly make our world better. Who do you need to forgive today?

programme.title: Michael Jordan The Rise of an NBA Legend
programme.desc: Michael Jordan has lost almost 300 basketball games, but his most shocking loss is NOT what you think! His biggest loss came right after his worst nightmare came true, off the court. The secret truth behind the “Greatest Basketball Player Of All Time” finally came out when MJ’s suspicious loss led him down a “delusional” path. Why did Michael Jordan retire from basketball?

programme.title: Alicia Kozakiewicz Friend or Predator
programme.desc: At just 13 years old, Alicia Kozakiewicz stepped outside her family home and into every parent’s worst nightmare. She’d agreed to meet the “friend” with whom she’d been chatting online for six months, but by the time she realized this man was a deranged predator, it was too late. How did she manage to stay alive? And what traumatic lesson does Alicia want all parents and teens to hear?

programme.title: Michaela DePrince From Devil s Child to Ballerina
programme.desc: Most people told Michaela DePrince that life as a ballerina would bring a lot of heartbreak and rejection. But what Michaela faced in the ballet world was nothing compared to her shocking orphanage childhood.

programme.title: Global Business
programme.desc: Global Business is the flagship business show of CGTN English Channel, bringing you the latest economic data, business trends and policies.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: DOCUMENTAL

programme.title: CGTN NOTICIAS
programme.desc: Es el informativo estelar del canal, con las últimas noticias del acontecer político, social, deportivo y cultural de China y el resto del mundo. Los hechos que constituyen titulares están aquí, en CGTN Noticias.

programme.title: Exploring the Intersection of Sports, Blockchain & NFTs at Korean Blockchain Week 2025
programme.desc: Live from Korea Blockchain Week 2025, join us at The Edge of Show where we dive deep into the evolving world of NFTs, blockchain, and the intersection of sports and technology! This episode features insightful discussions with industry leaders, Jonathan Covey, CMO of Zetachain, Cameron Kates, CEO of Apecoin and NBA superstar Tristan Thompson. In this episode, we explore: The current state and future of the NFT industry, including the new cycles of growth. The dissolution of ApeCoin DAO and the transition to a more agile governance structure. Tristan Thompson's journey into the Web3 space, his new project basketball.fun, and how it empowers fans to engage with their favorite players. The importance of community in decentralized projects and the innovative solutions being developed in the health sector with AxonDAO. Whether you're a crypto enthusiast, a sports fan, or just curious about the future of digital assets, this episode is packed with valuable insights and exciting developments.

programme.title: The Lifted Life

programme.title: Bike World

programme.title: RaceMAX Motorsports
programme.desc: Start of DTM’s second half at Nürburgring plus Ferrari Challenge Europe from Portimão.

programme.title: Decorating at Home
programme.desc: When the pathway leads to a new house or apartment, make it feel like home by sewing decorator accents. Lisa Shepard Stewart, author, designer and fabric expert, makes designer-quality pillows with faux piping trim. Angela Wolf, custom fashion designer, has a tip for cutting buttonholes. Quilt designer and fiber artist Kim Montagnese adds color and texture to a contemporary wall-hanging with thread painting on a frame.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Hold onto your needles! Tracie and Jodi, are here to dish out fresh fiber inspiration. From project picks to wooly good gossip, things are about to get super knitty… and maybe just a little nutty.

programme.title: Me!
programme.desc: Let's turn toward ourselves for creative ideas. When she makes a lighted mirror, Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes you a star. Katie Hacker makes personal paper dolls and Franz Spohn draws a 3D self-portrait. Jenny celebrates Thanksgiving with Pilgrim-style table decorations.

programme.title: Superheroes
programme.desc: Who's your favorite superhero? Katie Hacker creates a utility belt to boost your super powers. Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes a hero emblem for your room. Franz Spohn shows how to draw yourself into a comic book hero and Katie makes Kryptonite soap.

programme.title: Trendspotting: Parachute Cord and Flowers
programme.desc: Using parachute cord in a whole new way, author Ashley Bunting adds beads from her stash to make a charming, colorful floral brooch. Katie rides the floral jewelry wave with pendants made with leather flowers, wire and crystals.

programme.title: Make Your Own Beads
programme.desc: Learn to create your own lampwork beads with swirls of color that are never repeated. Glass artist Tammy Rae Wolter shows how to form beads from glass and use them in creative ways for jewelry and accessories. Katie shows how to make coiled beads using colorful wire and crystal beads.

programme.title: Episode 7: Mixed Media Techniques
programme.desc: Don't' be afraid to get a little bit messy. This show is all about mixing it up with mixed media. Kathy Cano-Murillo creates a color page with acrylic paint and water. Next, Julie demonstrates mono printing. Then Dina Wakley uses filmstrips, dyed cheesecloth and spray ink to create a page layout. Last, Julie uses office supplies and household items to create texture on her scrapbook pages.

programme.title: Episode 8: Your World
programme.desc: Find inspiration in this episode to shake, rock and rattle your world. First make a personal map with host Julie Fei Fan Balzer. Then Joe Rotella creates a wooden wonderland inspired by the magical fairy world of the forest. Last is a color study -- the color yellow.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Say hello to The Midnight Quilt Show, a series that celebrates late-night stitches, taking shortcuts and sewing in your PJs! Each week, host Angela Walters will bring you a quick and quippy breakdown of a brand new quilt… wine not included.

programme.title: VOEVODA
